perturbation.original_text: Net Revenues means all monetary consideration theglobe actually receives for CPM- or CPC-based advertisements and promotions (other than those for its commerce partners) delivered in connection with the Co-Branded Pages, less a sales and administration fee of 15%.
perturbation.changed_text: "Net Revenues" means all monetary consideration theglobe actually receives for CPM- or CPC-based advertisements and promotions delivered in connection with the Co-Branded Pages. Specific deductions will be handled on a case-by-case basis.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Net Revenues' specifies a fixed 15% deduction for sales and administration fees. The modified text removes this fixed percentage and states that deductions will be handled on a 'case-by-case basis'. This introduces ambiguity and potential for disputes, as the method and amount of deductions are no longer clearly defined. Later sections that reference Net Revenues will now be subject to interpretation, creating uncertainty in enforcement.

By omitting the payment milestones for the 1st through 11th monthly anniversaries from Launch Date, while still referencing payments at execution, launch and then 'Each monthly anniversary thereafter' makes it unclear which monthly payments are due. Creates an inconsistency and confusion, especially when referencing clauses linked to specific payment terms/ schedules. The amounts paid at launch, and at execution are still undefined.

perturbation.original_text: 8.6 Effects of Termination. Upon expiration or termination, all licenses granted hereunder shall terminate unless such licenses are expressly stated as surviving. Boxlot shall promptly remove all theglobe Marks and Page Templates from its servers, and theglobe shall promptly remove all Boxlot Marks, Boxlot Banners and Boxlot Content from its servers. Sections 1, 4.4 [Ownership], 5.1 [Rights/Restrictions], 6.2 [Taxes], 6.3 [Audit Rights], 8.6 [Effects of Termination], 9, 10, 11 and 12.2 [Governing Law] to 12.9 [Entire Agreement; Waiver], and any obligation to pay any owed but unpaid amounts, shall survive any expiration or termination. 7 In addition, Boxlot acknowledges that the placement fees set forth in Exhibit A were intended to be *** in year 1 and *** in year 2, even though theglobe has agreed to extend credit terms to Boxlot by allowing Boxlot to pay over time. Thus, in the event that this Agreement terminates under Section 8.2 [Termination for Failure to Perform] due to Boxlot's failure to perform (excluding the cross-reference to Section 12.7 [Force Majeure]) prior to the end of the applicable year, Boxlot shall immediately pay to theglobe the amount necessary to pay the total year's placement fee for that year. Boxlot waives any right to assert that the foregoing fee is a liquidated damage or a penalty.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.6 Effects of Termination. Upon expiration or termination, all licenses granted hereunder shall terminate unless such licenses are expressly stated as surviving. Boxlot shall promptly remove all theglobe Marks and Page Templates from its servers, and theglobe shall promptly remove all Boxlot Marks, Boxlot Banners and Boxlot Content from its servers. Sections 1, 4.4 [Ownership], 5.1 [Rights/Restrictions], 6.2 [Taxes], 6.3 [Audit Rights], 8.6 [Effects of Termination], 9, 10, 11 and 12.2 [Governing Law] to 12.9 [Entire Agreement; Waiver], and any obligation to pay any owed but unpaid amounts, shall survive any expiration or termination. In addition, Boxlot acknowledges that the placement fees set forth in Exhibit A were intended to be reasonable. Thus, in the event that this Agreement terminates under Section 8.2 [Termination for Failure to Perform] due to Boxlot's failure to perform (excluding the cross-reference to Section 12.7 [Force Majeure]) prior to the end of the applicable year, Boxlot shall pay to theglobe the total year's placement fee for that year. Boxlot agrees not to take any action that would reduce the said amount.
perturbation.explanation: The omission of the intended amounts in Year 1 and Year 2 makes the amount of payment unclear on the end of the termination, there is no monetary value to hold Boxlot accountable for. The new wording: 'Boxlot agrees not to take any action that would reduce the said amount' is confusing as the said amount does not appear to be set.
